tool.name: link
tool.summary: Sets construction variables for generic POSIX linkers.
tool.sets: SHLINK SHLINKFLAGS SHLINKCOM LINK LINKFLAGS LINKCOM LIBDIRPREFIX LIBDIRSUFFIX LIBLINKPREFIX LIBLINKSUFFIX SHLIBSUFFIX LDMODULE LDMODULEPREFIX LDMODULESUFFIX LDMODULEFLAGS LDMODULECOM

cvar.name: LDMODULE
cvar.summary: The linker for building loadable modules. By default, this is the same as &cv-link-SHLINK;.

cvar.name: LDMODULECOM
cvar.summary: The command line for building loadable modules. On Mac OS X, this uses the &cv-link-LDMODULE;, &cv-link-LDMODULEFLAGS; and &cv-link-FRAMEWORKSFLAGS; variables. On other systems, this is the same as &cv-link-SHLINK;.

cvar.name: LDMODULECOMSTR
cvar.summary: The string displayed when building loadable modules. If this is not set, then &cv-link-LDMODULECOM; (the command line) is displayed.

cvar.name: LDMODULEFLAGS
cvar.summary: General user options passed to the linker for building loadable modules.

cvar.name: LDMODULEPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for loadable module file names. On Mac OS X, this is null; on other systems, this is the same as &cv-link-SHLIBPREFIX;.

cvar.name: LDMODULESUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for loadable module file names. On Mac OS X, this is null; on other systems, this is the same as $SHLIBSUFFIX.

cvar.name: LINKCOM
cvar.summary: The command line used to link object files into an executable.

cvar.name: LINKCOMSTR
cvar.summary:
The string displayed when object files are linked into an executable. If this is not set, then &cv-link-LINKCOM; (the command line) is displayed.
env = Environment(LINKCOMSTR = "Linking $TARGET")

cvar.name: LINKFLAGS
cvar.summary: General user options passed to the linker. Note that this variable should not contain -l (or similar) options for linking with the libraries listed in &cv-link-LIBS;, nor -L (or similar) library search path options that scons generates automatically from &cv-link-LIBPATH;. See &cv-link-_LIBFLAGS; above, for the variable that expands to library-link options, and &cv-link-_LIBDIRFLAGS; above, for the variable that expands to library search path options.

cvar.name: SHLINK
cvar.summary: The linker for programs that use shared libraries.

cvar.name: SHLINKCOM
cvar.summary: The command line used to link programs using shared libaries.

cvar.name: SHLINKCOMSTR
cvar.summary:
The string displayed when programs using shared libraries are linked. If this is not set, then &cv-link-SHLINKCOM; (the command line) is displayed.
env = Environment(SHLINKCOMSTR = "Linking shared $TARGET")

cvar.name: SHLINKFLAGS
cvar.summary: General user options passed to the linker for programs using shared libraries. Note that this variable should not contain -l (or similar) options for linking with the libraries listed in &cv-link-LIBS;, nor -L (or similar) include search path options that scons generates automatically from &cv-link-LIBPATH;. See &cv-link-_LIBFLAGS; above, for the variable that expands to library-link options, and &cv-link-_LIBDIRFLAGS; above, for the variable that expands to library search path options.
